data.title: Burundi
data.text:
The provinces of Ruanda and Urundi were combined and administered by Belgium as part of the Belgian Congo (1954 to 1960). After the Belgian Congo achieved independence as the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ruanda and Urundi reverted to their former names of Rwanda and Burundi, and used a common currency issued by a central bank (B.E.R.B) until 1964. After that, each country became a separate entity.

Rwanda-Burundi on Wikipedia

All coin images in Daniel's Coin Zoo are from my personal collection. I collect, research, and personally photograph every coin displayed on this site. PLEASE do not take my images without permission. If you would like to use any coin image you see, just ask me. Thank you.
